title: Health Sensing HW - Optical Module Design Engineer
summary: The Health Sensing Hardware team is looking for a highly-motivated optical engineer to work on the next-generation of optical health sensors. Seeking a candidate with training in optical system design, modeling, and fabrication for developing optical health sensors in the Apple Watch.
description: We work as a team of research scientists and hardware engineers developing technologies for the optical health sensors. Responsibilities include optical sensor simulations, prototype-based assessments, user studies, and data analysis to improve the understanding of tissue-sensor interactions. Role requires collaboration with mechanical, electrical, and software engineers.
key_qualifications: HW engineer with expertise in design of optical assemblies, experience planning user studies, skilled in ray-tracing/optical design software, proficient in programming languages, experience with optical system design for high-volume production, knowledge of light transport in biological tissue, excellent communication skills, experience in test platform development, collaborative and willing to work in a fast-paced environment.
education_experience: BS and a minimum of 3 years relevant experience
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay ranges between $143,100 and $264,200 depending on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Employees have the opportunity to become shareholders, receive comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, discounted products and free services, reimbursement for educational expenses, and more.
